title: Trump Admin Cuts Funding to Dem States Amid Shutdown
snippets: Republicans and Democrats fail to narrow differences on spending bill, as effects of shutdown start showing.

The Trump administration has begun targeting funding projects in Democratic states. And Vice President JD Vance warned that the government might sack federal workers if the shutdown lasts more than a few days.

summary: The Trump administration has started cutting funding for projects in Democratic states amid a government shutdown that began at midnight on Wednesday. With Democrats and Republicans unable to agree on a funding deal, Vice President JD Vance warned of potential layoffs of federal workers if the shutdown extends beyond a few days.

title: Jane Goodall, Celebrated Primatologist, Dies at 91
snippets: The Jane Goodall Institute says famed primatologist died in California during US speaking tour.

Jane Goodall, the trailblazing naturalist whose intimate observations of chimpanzees in the African wild produced powerful insights that transformed basic conceptions of humankind, has died. She was 91.
Jane Goodall's powers of observation revealed facts scholars had overlooked for years. She died at 91 on October 1.

British primatologist Jane Goodall, who transformed the study of chimpanzees and became one of the world's most prominent wildlife advocates, has died at the age of 91, her institute announced Wednesday.

Dr. Jane Goodall, one of the world’s most beloved animal behaviorists and a pioneer in primatology has died at the age of 91, the Jane Goodall Institute confirmed Wednesday. The British scientist, best known for her groundbreaking work with chimpanzees in Tanzania’s Gombe Stream National
titles: Jane Goodall, conservationist and chimpanzee expert, dies aged 91
Jane Goodall, who transformed understanding of humankind by studying chimpanzees, dies at 91
Jane Goodall, chimpanzee researcher and conservationist, is dead at 91
Renowned British chimpanzee expert Jane Goodall dies at 91
Renowned primatologist Dr. Jane Goodall dead at 91
summary: Renowned British primatologist and conservationist Jane Goodall, celebrated for her groundbreaking research on chimpanzees and advocacy for wildlife, passed away at the age of 91 on October 1, as announced by her institute.

title: Israeli Navy Stops Flotilla Near Gaza; Red Cross Halts Gaza Activities
snippets: The Global Sumud Flotilla, with Greta Thunberg, Nelson Mandela's grandson and European lawmakers aboard, includes some 50 boats and 500 activists and is carrying a symbolic amount of humanitarian aid.
Climate activist Greta Thunberg is among activists on the Global Sumud Flotilla being taken to an Israeli port.
Activists on the Global Sumud Flotilla shared a video they said showed Israeli vessels intercepting the fleet.

The Israeli Navy intercepted the Global Sumud Flotilla from advancing to the Gaza coast. Meanwhile, the Red Cross says Israel's offensive has "forced" it to pause activities in Gaza City. DW has more.
titles: Activists say Israel's navy has begun intercepting a Gaza-bound aid flotilla
Israeli naval ships intercept Gaza-bound flotilla
Israel begins to intercept Global Sumud Flotilla vessels
Middle East: Israel intercepts Gaza aid flotilla
summary: The Israeli Navy intercepted the Global Sumud Flotilla, which was heading towards the Gaza coast. The flotilla had entered what it described as a "high-risk zone." Following the interception, the Red Cross announced a pause in its activities in Gaza City due to Israel's offensive. This development was reported by activists on the flotilla and covered by DW.

title: PSG Clinches 2-1 Victory Over Barcelona with Last-Minute Goal by Ramos
snippets: Ramos' 90th minute goal capped off a come from behind win at Barcelona in the league phase of the UEFA Champions League.
The PSG striker revealed how the Bayern Munich man's goal vs. Barcelona helped him on Wednesday

PSG came from behind to claim a dramatic 2-1 win over FC Barcelona on Wednesday night at Montjuïc Stadium. Barcelona struck first, but two late goals propelled PSG to take all three points.Ferran Tor...

The goal that won this game was a portrait of how it had been played: all in, all the way to the end. A move that started deep in Paris Saint-Germain’s half with Lee Kang-in chased backwards, turning, escaping and going at the same opponents who had been pursuing him, ended in the Barcelona penal
titles: PSG defeat Barcelona in Champions League after late Goncalo Ramos winner
How a Harry Kane Champions League goal played a big role in Goncalo Ramos's winner for PSG at Barcelona
Ferran Torres Responds After Barcelona Suffer Champions League Loss to PSG
Paris Saint-Germain stun Barcelona with late Gonçalo Ramos winner
summary: In a UEFA Champions League match, PSG secured a dramatic come-from-behind 2-1 victory against FC Barcelona at Montjuïc Stadium, with a decisive 90th-minute goal by Ramos. The win was highlighted by a pivotal moment involving a strategic play from deep within PSG's half, leading to the winning goal. This result was part of the league phase of the competition.

title: Oktoberfest Reopens After Closure Due to Bomb Threat Linked to Domestic Dispute
snippets: Explosions and a fire at a detached house in northern Munich triggered a large police response. The suspect was found injured and later died, but authorities found no link or threat to the Oktoberfest beer festival.
Hours after a written threat, by a suspect who killed himself, authorities said the beer celebration would reopen after a search of the grounds found no explosives.
The German authorities said the decision to close the festival grounds was taken after an earlier explosion in a residential area of the city that appeared linked to a domestic dispute.

MUNICH (AP) — The Oktoberfest fairgrounds closed for several hours Wednesday as police conducted a security sweep of the famed beer festival due to a bomb threat by a suspect linked to an explosion across town in northern Munich. Police in Bavaria, the state where Munich is located, said the suspect
titles: Oktoberfest back on after Munich bomb scare
Oktoberfest in Munich cleared to reopen after bomb threat
Bomb Threat Delays Oktoberfest in Munich
Police say Oktoberfest reopens after a security sweep due to a bomb threat
summary: The Oktoberfest beer festival in Munich, Germany, was temporarily closed due to a bomb threat linked to an explosion and fire in a residential area, suspected to be connected to a domestic dispute. The threat came from a suspect who later committed suicide. After a thorough security sweep of the festival grounds revealed no explosives, authorities announced the event would reopen on Wednesday evening. The closure was a precautionary measure to ensure public safety.

title: Israeli Navy Intercepts Ships with Activists, Including Thunberg, Near Gaza
snippets: At least six ships have been boarded by the Israeli navy so far and more interceptions are expected to take place.

Greta Thunberg arrested and taken into custody after six of the flotilla’s boats were boarded

  • Middle East crisis live

A number of
Israeli foreign ministry posts video of Thunberg’s arrest; vessels carrying about 500 activists intercepted about 75 miles off coast of war-torn territory
Organizers said 20 boats have been intercepted and at least 200 passengers detained as the convoy presses on toward Gaza to try to break the Israeli blockade.
titles: Israeli forces board Gaza flotilla, detain Greta Thunberg, other activists
Israeli naval forces board pro-Palestinian flotilla 75 miles from Gaza
Gaza aid flotilla: more than a dozen vessels intercepted by Israeli forces; Greta Thunberg arrested – live
Israel intercepts Gaza aid flotilla, activist Greta Thunberg detained
summary: The Israeli navy has intercepted at least six ships carrying around 500 activists, including Greta Thunberg, about 75 miles off the coast of Gaza. Thunberg has been arrested and taken into custody. This action is part of a broader conflict that has resulted in at least 73 Palestinian deaths in Gaza as Israeli forces arrest activists. Further interceptions are anticipated.

title: Renowned Primatologist Jane Goodall Dies at 91
snippets: The Jane Goodall Institute said the renowned chimpanzee researcher died of natural causes at the age of 91.
Acclaimed conservationist and chimpanzee expert Jane Goodall has died, leaving behind a legacy of empathy for primates and the natural world

Jane Goodall Institute says ‘tireless advocate’ for natural world died in California during US speaking tour

The world-renowned primatologist Jane Goodall has died at the age of 91, her institute has said.

The Jane Goodall Institute announced that she had died of natural causes while
titles: Primatologist Jane Goodall has died at the age of 91, her institute has said
Jane Goodall, dogged advocate for the natural world, has died aged 91
Jane Goodall, world-renowned primatologist, dies aged 91
summary: Jane Goodall, the celebrated primatologist known for her pioneering research on chimpanzee behavior, has died at the age of 91. The Jane Goodall Institute announced she passed away of natural causes during a speaking tour in the US. Goodall, a British scientist, transformed our understanding of apes and was a tireless advocate for the natural world.

title: Three Arrested in Berlin for Alleged Plot Against Jewish Targets
snippets: The men are suspected of of being 'foreign operatives' for Hamas and will appear in court Thursday, prosecutors say.
Authorities said two Germans and one Lebanese national had procured weapons to be used in violent acts targeting Israeli or Jewish institutions in Germany.
Police seized weapons and ammunition while arresting the three men in Berlin, Germany’s federal prosecutor’s office said.
titles: Germany arrests three men suspected of targeting Jewish institutions
Germany arrests 3 suspected Hamas members
Germany arrests three suspected Hamas members in plot to attack Jews
summary: Two Germans and one Lebanese national, suspected of being Hamas operatives, were arrested in Berlin for planning violent acts against Israeli or Jewish institutions in Germany. Authorities seized an AK-47, pistols, and ammunition. They are set to appear in court Thursday, according to prosecutors.

title: Canucks Dominate Flames 8-1 in NHL Pre-Season Game
snippets: Quinn Hughes had a goal and two assists, Max Sasson scored twice and the Vancouver Canucks rolled past the Calgary Flames 8-1 on Wednesday in NHL pre-season action.
Quinn Hughes had a goal and three points on the night, Elias Pettersson racked up two points, and the Vancouver Canucks dominated the Calgary Flames 8-1.
Ryan Winterton scored twice, Josh Mahura and Eeli Tolvanen added goals of their own, and Joey Daccord made 32 saves to elevate the Seattle Kraken to a 4-2 victory over the Edmonton Oilers.
Cutter Gauthier, Frank Vatrano, Beckett Sennecke, Sam Colangelo and Yegor Sidorov all scored while Calle Clang finished with 26 saves as the Anaheim Ducks defeated the San Jose Sharks 5-2.
William Karlsson and Brett Howden each scored while Akira Schmid allowed just one goal on 22 shots as the Vegas Golden Knights went on to defeat the Colorado Avalanche 2-1.
Filip Hollander and Matthew Dumba tallied a goal and an assist each, and Arturs Silovs made 27 saves as the Pittsburgh Penguins defeated the Buffalo Sabres 5-3.
titles: Canucks thump Flames 8-1 in pre-season action
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Canucks 8, Flames 1
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Kraken 4, Oilers 2
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Ducks 5, Sharks 2
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Golden Knights 2, Avalanche 1
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Penguins 5, Sabres 3
summary: In an NHL pre-season game on Wednesday, the Vancouver Canucks decisively defeated the Calgary Flames 8-1. Quinn Hughes contributed significantly with a goal and two assists, while Max Sasson scored twice for the Canucks.

title: EU Leaders Discuss Hybrid War with Russia, Support for Ukraine in Denmark
snippets: Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen says that Europe is in a hybrid war waged by Russia, and Ukraine is first line of defence.

EU leaders met in Denmark to discuss how best to counter drones after mysterious flights in the Nordic country. Ways to fund Ukraine during Russia's invasion were also a focus of the meeting. DW has more.
titles: Zelenskyy meeting European leaders in Denmark to rally support for Ukraine
European leaders in Denmark talk drones, Ukraine funding
summary: At a meeting in Denmark, EU leaders, including Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen, discussed the ongoing conflict involving Russia. Frederiksen described Europe as being in a hybrid war with Russia, identifying Ukraine as the front line of defense. The meeting focused on countering drone threats after mysterious flights in the Nordic region and exploring funding options for Ukraine amidst the Russian invasion.

title: Italian Unions Strike in Global Protest Against Israel's Flotilla Action
snippets: Italian unions call for general strike as global protests grow and multiple governments criticise Israel.
Thousands marched in cities across the world following the interception of the flotilla and detainment of activists including Greta Thunberg
titles: How the world is responding to Israel’s interception of the Gaza flotilla
Israel’s Gaza flotilla interception triggers protests, diplomatic expulsions and calls for strikes
summary: Italian unions have called for a general strike, joining global protests after Israel intercepted a flotilla, detaining activists like Greta Thunberg. Thousands have marched worldwide, with multiple governments criticizing Israel's actions.

title: Yamamoto's 9 Ks Propel Dodgers to NLDS, Ohtani to Debut vs Phillies
snippets: Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out nine to lead the Dodgers past the Reds and into the NLDS, where Shohei Ohtani will start the opener against the Phillies.
Shohei Ohtani’s post-season pitching debut will come in Game 1 of the NLDS.
titles: Yamamoto puts L.A. in NLDS; Ohtani to start G1
Dodgers’ Shohei Ohtani to start Game 1 of NLDS on mound
summary: Yoshinobu Yamamoto led the Dodgers to victory over the Reds with nine strikeouts, advancing them to the NLDS. Shohei Ohtani is set to make his post-season pitching debut in Game 1 against the Phillies.

title: Chisholm Jr. Leads Yankees to 4-3 Win Over Red Sox, Forces Game 3
snippets: One day after he was benched, Jazz Chisholm turned in a season-saving performance for the Yankees, making a run-saving play with his glove and scoring the tiebreaking run in Wednesday's do-or-die Game 2 against the Red Sox.
After being upset that he wasn’t in the lineup for Game 1, Jazz Chisholm Jr. came back and had his fingerprints over the Yankees’ Game 2 win on Wednesday.

Ben Rice went 2-for-4 with a solo shot in his first postseason appearance, and Austin Wells knocked in the game-winning run in the eighth inning as the New York Yankees defeated the Boston Red Sox 4-3, to force a winner-take-all Game 3.
titles: Chisholm turns page, saves Yanks to force Game 3
Chisholm Jr. shakes off frustration, leads Yankees past Red Sox to force Game 3
MLB Game 2 Highlights: Yankees 4, Red Sox 3
summary: Jazz Chisholm Jr. delivered a crucial performance in Game 2 for the Yankees, making a key defensive play and scoring the tiebreaking run in a 4-3 victory over the Red Sox. This win, following his benching in Game 1, helped the Yankees force a decisive Game 3. Ben Rice and Austin Wells also contributed significantly, with Rice hitting a solo homer and Wells driving in the game-winning run.

summary: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, aged 32, has announced his retirement from professional football, just days following a criticized performance against the Rams. This decision was communicated to his team, the Colts, marking the end of his career in the NFL.

title: Nashville SC Wins First U.S. Open Cup, Beats Austin FC 2-1
snippets: Nashville SC beat Austin FC 2-1 in final of the U.S. Open Cup on Wednesday night at Q2 Stadium to win the team's first-ever major trophy.
A narrow win on the road gave Nashville the title, their first as a club
titles: Nashville lifts 1st major trophy with Open Cup win
Nashville SC edge Austin FC to win first U.S. Open Cup in club history and Tennessee's first pro sports trophy
summary: Nashville SC won their first major trophy by defeating Austin FC 2-1 in the U.S. Open Cup final on Wednesday night at Q2 Stadium. Sam Surridge scored the decisive goal with a penalty in the 60th minute, securing the victory for Nashville in the historic knockout tournament, which has been held since 1914.

title: Las Vegas, Phoenix Vie for 2025 WNBA Title Starting Friday

It's Las Vegas vs. Phoenix for the 2025 title

2025 WNBA Finals: Aces vs. Mercury schedule, prediction, players to watch
summary: Las Vegas and Phoenix are set to compete in the WNBA Finals starting Friday, with the 2025 title at stake. The outcome will likely hinge on which team's top three players perform best.

title: London & Valley Water to Cut Debt, Invest More, Cover Pollution Fines

Creditors in control of firm say they will write off loans, invest more and commit to paying pollution fines

titles: Thames Water lenders submit rescue plan to stave off collapse

summary: London & Valley Water, controlled by a consortium of investors, announced plans to reduce the company's significant debts by writing off loans. Additionally, they have committed to investing further in the company and covering any fines related to pollution. This move aims to stabilize the firm's financial health and address environmental concerns.

Keir Starmer highlighted changes to resettlement and family reunion rights amidst concerns.

title: EU Mulls "Drone Wall" for Eastern Border Security Boost
snippets: A series of airspace violations allegedly involving Russian jets or drones have been reported in recent weeks.
The European Union is talking about shoring up defenses in its eastern airspace. Recent Russian drone incursions have lent urgency to the project.
titles: ‘We stand ready’: Defense giants welcome Europe’s push to build a drone wall to repel Russia
What Is Europe’s ‘Drone Wall’?
summary: EU leaders are discussing implementing new defense measures, including a "drone wall" near the Russian border, to strengthen eastern Europe's airspace. This comes in response to recent Russian drone incursions, highlighting the urgency of enhancing security in the area.

snippets: Tory leader reaches out to voters hit by high energy bills but faces backlash from business and within the party

Tory leader says she would replace it with ‘cheap energy’ strategy, ending decades-long consensus on climate

Kemi Badenoch has vowed to repeal the Climate Change Act if the Conservatives win the next election, doing away with controls on greenhouse gas emissions and dismantling what has bee
titles: Badenoch pledges to ditch flagship UK climate change law
Kemi Badenoch vows to repeal Climate Change Act
summary: Tory leader Kemi Badenoch promises to repeal the Climate Change Act and introduce a 'cheap energy' strategy if elected, aiming to lower energy bills. This plan involves removing greenhouse gas emission controls, sparking backlash from businesses and members within her party.

title: Supreme Court Blocks Trump's Bid to Dismiss Fed's Cook Amid Fraud Claims
snippets: Supreme Court says Fed governor Cook can remain in job pending arguments &
President Donald Trump has sought to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, citing claims that she committed mortgage fraud in connection with two homes.
titles: Supreme Court says Fed governor Cook can remain in job pending arguments - Axios
Supreme Court lets Fed Governor Lisa Cook keep job pending January oral argument
summary: The Supreme Court has temporarily halted President Trump's attempt to dismiss Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, amidst allegations of mortgage fraud. This decision preserves the central bank's independence for now and marks a significant moment as it's the first instance of a president attempting to fire a Fed official. Cook will maintain her position pending further court deliberations.

title: US Government Acquires 10% Stake in Major Lithium Mine Projects
snippets: Vancouver-based Lithium Americas is developing one of world's largest lithium mines in northern Nevada.

Donald Trump’s administration is taking a 5 percent equity ownership of mining company Lithium Americas, on top of another 5 percent stake in the company’s joint mining project with GM in Nevada, the Department of Energy announced yesterday. The mine at Thacker Pass is expected to become the largest
titles: US takes a stake in another firm, this time a large lithium mine
US government takes equity stake in one of the world’s largest lithium mines
summary: The U.S. Department of Energy, under Donald Trump's administration, acquired a 5% equity stake in Lithium Americas, a Vancouver-based company developing one of the world's largest lithium mines in northern Nevada. Additionally, the government secured another 5% stake in the company's joint venture with GM at the same location, Thacker Pass, which is anticipated to become the largest lithium mine.

title: Northern Irish Designer Debuts at Dior, Unites Collections at Paris Fashion Week

All eyes were on the Northern Irish designer’s debut – not just to reinvent Dior, but to jolt fashion itself out of its slump

titles: ‘Dior is drama’: Jonathan Anderson goes for the jugular at Paris fashion week

summary: At Paris Fashion Week, Northern Irish designer's debut for Dior, aimed at revitalizing the brand and the fashion industry, was highly anticipated. The event, attended by Oscar winners Mikey Madison and Charlize Theron, marked a significant moment as the designer successfully merged Dior's women's and men's collections, enhancing the brand's identity and equity.

title: California Mandates AI Safety Transparency, First State to Do So
snippets: “Are bills like SB 53 the thing that will stop us from beating China? No,” said Adam Billen, vice president of public policy at youth-led advocacy group Encode AI. “I think it is just genuinely intellectually dishonest to say that that is the thing that will stop us in the race.”

California just made history as the first state to require AI safety transparency from the biggest labs in the industry. Governor Newsom signed SB 53 into law this week, mandating that AI giants like OpenAI and Anthropic disclose, and stick to, their safety protocols. The decision is already sparkin
titles: California’s new AI safety law shows regulation and innovation don’t have to clash
Why California’s new AI safety law succeeded where SB 1047 failed
summary: California has become the first state to mandate AI safety transparency from major labs, with Governor Newsom signing SB 53 into law. This requires companies like OpenAI and Anthropic to disclose their safety protocols. Adam Billen from Encode AI commented that attributing the slowing of U.S. competitiveness with China to such laws is "intellectually dishonest."
